examples: six of Sweden’s top financial experts
Ten people were invited but only six turned up.
Can you lend me six dollars?
I can't read your writing—is this meant to be a six?
The bulbs are planted in fours or sixes (= groups of four or six).
We moved to America when I was six (= six years old).
Shall we meet at six (= at six o'clock), then?

meanings.def: a hit that scores six runs (= points)
in a confused state; not well organized
examples: I haven't had time to clear up, so I'm all at sixes and sevens.

meanings.def: to be dead and buried in the ground

examples: The business over the lawsuit had really knocked her for six.

meanings.def: used to say that there is not much real difference between two possible choices

idioms.def: in a confused state; not well organized
examples: I haven't had time to clear up, so I'm all at sixes and sevens.

idioms.def: to be dead and buried in the ground

examples: The business over the lawsuit had really knocked her for six.

idioms.idiom: it’s six of one and half a dozen of the other
idioms.def: used to say that there is not much real difference between two possible choices

related: it’s six of one and half a dozen of the other
